comment: Sweet notes on nose on top of light heat and scent of red wine. Flavor is minimal with oak flavor but does open up a bit with ice. Good as a mixer.
3 Stars - Enjoyable, but a bit more bite than flavor. Flavor eventually builds... but a little too hot.
Definitely a little sweet to the taste reminding me of Angel's Envy.  A bit surprised at the expert rating because I like it more than most others in my collection.
Vanilla nose.  Stats or sweet.  Long fruity finish with a bit of a nice burn and spice.  Overall smooth.
Not a fan. I could really taste  corn tone that I despise. It does have a decent spice but all in all I am  disappointed. I will reserve this bottle for guest that don't know better or aren't picky
I like it a lot, but a bit of a swampy aftertaste
Not worth top shelf price.  starts sweet, ends harsh.
Needs ice or water to open the flavor profile more. Not a bad whiskey, but more like a $25 bottle.
NWF 2017.  Decent, but not worth the price.
too much corny spice on the back end
Notes of oak and spice. Sweet finish
not a pleasant flavor, wouldn't buy again
Had in an old fashion. Very good!
The taste does not follow up the aroma appropriately. Disappointing
Caramel, cherry, sharp and almost hollow without ice.
Okay. Nothing special. The rye is way way better

very little on the nose.  I tasted with a splash of water and was fairly unimpressed.  it had some toasted oak notes on the front end, but nothing lingering after that.  kinda fits the political name - long on promise and short on delivery.
Definitely different than the rye and not as sweet but a good kick and taste of pumpernickel.
